common

Class ImageRandomAccessReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.ImageRandomAccessReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteStreamReader, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageRandomAccessWriter

    public class ImageRandomAccessReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ByteStreamReader
    A seekable binary stream reader backed by RandomAccessFile.

    Provides refined methods for reading primitive types with configurable byte order to determine endian-ness. Unlike standard streams, this class maintains an internal LIFO stack for marked positions, allowing for nested navigation into sub-structures (i.e. TIFF IFDs or PNG chunks) and returning to previous offsets via reset().

    Since:
    25 January 2026
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • mark

        public void mark()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Pushes the current file pointer onto the internal mark stack. A subsequent call to reset() will pop this position and return the reader to it.
        Specified by:
        mark in interface ByteStreamReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while retrieving the file pointer

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns to the position recorded by the most recent mark(). This operation pops the position from the stack.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ByteStreamReader
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the mark stack is empty
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a null-terminated string (C-style) using the specified charset. The file pointer is advanced past both the string data and the null terminator.
        Parameters:
        charset - the character encoding for decoding the string
        Returns:
        the decoded string without the null terminator
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the detected string length exceeds Integer.MAX_VALUE
        java.io.IOException - if a null terminator is not found or EOF is reached

      • readAllBytes

        public byte[] readAllBytes()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire file into a byte array. This is a non-advancing operation, the file pointer is restored to its original position.
        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the entire file binary data or an empty array if the file is empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the detected string length exceeds Integer.MAX_VALUE
        java.io.IOException - if file size exceeds 2GB

                    throws java.io.IOException
        Validates that enough bytes remain in the file for the subsequent operation.
        Parameters:
        byteLen - the number of bytes required
        Throws:
        java.io.EOFException - if insufficient bytes remain
        java.io.IOException
